queries: Signers also regularly produce this sign with the dominant hand moving in a repeated shallow downwards arcing movement to the left.
verbLexeme: 1. To play billiards, snooker or pool.
nominalLexeme: 1. A game played on a large table, in which you use a long stick called a cue to hit small heavy balls against each other or into pockets around the sides of the table. English = billiards, snooker, pool.
oldEntry: Popular explanation: using a billiard cue.
